short.am,ar,bg,bn,ca,cs,da,de,el,en,en_AU,en_G: Add fullscreen button to the Chrome toolbar and to the context (right-click) menu
short.fr: Ajoutez un bouton de plein Ã©cran Ã  la barre d'outils de Chrome et au menu contextuel (clic droit)

long.am,ar,bg,bn,ca,cs,da,de,el,en,en_AU,en_G:
ðŸ“š DESCRIPTION

This is just a full-screen button, added to the toolbar and the context menu. It does exactly the same as the keyboard shortcuts (F11 on Windows or fn+F on Mac). You can change the icon to match your chrome theme and that's it.

I made this because I need to be able to click a button/menu item with the mouse, not all of my browsers come with keyboard. When in full screen, I need the context menu to get back. That's why this extension adds itself in the right-menu also. And that's it.

ðŸ›  OPTIONS

To change the default settings, simply right-click on the extension icon and select "Options". On the settings page, you can change the icon to a different color  (to match your Chrome theme or simply because you don't like the default black color) or even set your own icon.

ðŸ”’ PERMISSIONS

Rest assured, this extension doesn't require any special or risky permissions. The only permissions it needs are "contextMenu" and "storage." It doesn't access your data or sites. Its sole purpose is to add the buttons to the toolbar and context menu while saving the selected icon in local storage.
long.fr:
DESCRIPTION

This is just a full-screen button added to the toolbar. It does exactly the same as the keyboard shortcuts (F11 on Windows or Cmd+Shift+F on Mac). You can change the icon and add/remove the full-screen function to the context menu.

OPTIONS

To change the default settings -- right-click on the extension and select "Options". On the settings page you can:
* Change the icon to different color (to fit your Chrome theme or just because you don't like the default black color) or even set our own icon
* Add/remove the Full Screen item in the context menu

PERMISSIONS

This extension doesn't need any special or dangerous permissions. It doesn't read your data or sites. The only thing it does is to add the buttons to the toolbar and context menu.
